text.value: The poem takes the form of a dialogue. Critics have offered interesting ideas about the nature and identity of Patience, the voice which addresses Milton. Which of the following interpretations is most easily supported by the evidence of the text?

value.value: the personified voice of the heavenly virtue, Patience
the dramatized voice of the poetâ€™s conscience, or better self
there is no explicit reference to angels
God is referred to in the 3rd person
